com.apriori.concurrent

Class FutureListenerSet<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.FutureListenerSet<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of result for the listenable future
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class FutureListenerSet<T>
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Represents a set of listeners. ListenableFuture implementations can use this class to manage the set of registered listeners.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      Invokes all registered listeners.
      Runnable snapshot()
      Returns a task that will execute a snapshot of the set of listeners.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • snapshot

        public Runnable snapshot()
        Returns a task that will execute a snapshot of the set of listeners. This can be used to invoke listeners more than once since run() can only be invoked once. Listeners added to the set after this snapshot is taken will not be invoked when the returned task is run.
        Returns:
        a task that represents a snapshot of the listeners and will invoke those listeners when run

      • run

        public void run()
        Invokes all registered listeners. This should only be invoked when the corresponding future is complete. Subsequent attempts to add a listener to the set will result in the listener being executed immediately.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called more than once
